result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall Ray Mellenthin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report to Probation and Parole.  If revoked, the defendant has one days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Cases 22CM4, 22CM18 and 21CM67 are all concurrent to each other.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions. Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court. Defendant granted a payment plan of $100.00 per month to begin 08/01/2022, to include 22CM4, 22CM18 and 21CM67
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Ray Mellenthin

records.addlTxt: 10:09 AM Defendant Randall Ray Mellenthin in court.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Randall Ray Mellenthin.   The defendant pled guilty to the charge. Rights given. Court finds that he has entered his plea knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant guilty.   State is in compliance in victim rights law.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 10:10 am.

9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall Ray Mellenthin in court.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video for Randall Ray Mellenthin. State's offer is accepted.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:10 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:14 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Randall Ray Mellenthin, appeared with Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video.  The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.
on request to appear remotely - granted

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 09:10 am.

DA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State; Defendant appeared in person, pro se; Defendant does not qualify for SPD; Court review Petition for Court Appted. Attorney; Court appoints an attorney, orders Defendant to repay $150.00/mo beginning on May 1, 2022; Court quashes warrant; Court sets AIA on May 12, 2022 at 9:10 a.m.; Court orders bonds reinstated as originally set

09:59 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Randall Ray Mellenthin did not appear.    Bench warrant was requested and authorized to be issued on the defendants failure to appear.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender
Adjourned initial appearance on April 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:41 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Randall Ray Mellenthin appeared, pro se.  Call the PD office and see if he qualifies.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on March 8, 2022 at 09:40 am.

01:28 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Randall Ray Mellenthin appeared, pro se  by video from Clark County Jail.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 09:40 am.
